page.title: 07An Arable Farm in Insch.
page.content: My Dad,his brother and my Grandad share 1030 acres of mixed arable land. They fatten cattle and lambs and they breed sheep.The animals are mostly sold through Aberdeen and Northen Marts,Insch.They grow winter barley, winter wheat,oil_seed rape,protein peas and spring barley for malting. After the crops have been harvested they are dried and stored and then marketed through Union Grain,White_ rashes.The average price you would get for a tonne of barley is Â£106. My dad works from fifty to seventy hours a week and our busiest time of the year is harvest.My dad has modern machinery such as a sprayer,round baler and a reversable plough. The main problem on his farm is over production of grain; another is the weather! My brother and I hope to carry on the farming tradition.
